subject: Sexual Health
title: Voice Changes
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Voice Changes.

hook.text: A boy's voice cracks and deepens during puberty because testosterone physically reshapes his voice box.

buildup.text: Testosterone causes the larynx to grow larger and the vocal cords to become thicker and longer.

discovery.text: The voice drops about an octave in boys. Girls' voices also deepen slightly, about 3 semitones on average.

twist.text: Voice cracking happens because the brain's motor control has not yet adapted to the rapidly changing vocal cords.

climax.text: By late puberty, the voice stabilizes as the brain masters control of the newly sized vocal apparatus.

punchline.text: Voice cracks are growing pains of the larynx.

quiz.question: Why does the voice crack during puberty?
options: The brain has not adapted to growing vocal cords
